docs.lead_paragraph: House and Senate leaders, usually proud sorts, staged showdown votes in their chambers Thursday on measures that are going nowhere. And in the logic that prevails during the weeks before crucial congressional elections, they want everyone to know about that futility.

headline.main: House, Senate Weigh Bills That Are Going Nowhere
headline.print_headline: House, Senate Weigh Bills That Are Going Nowhere

docs.lead_paragraph: The courts should reject a perverse new challenge to the law’s health insurance subsidies.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Brookings fellow Henry J Aaron, Prof David M Cutler and Citigroup vice chairman Peter R Orszag decries efforts by opponents of Affordable Care Act to convince courts that law requires subsidies to be paid only in states with online exchanges; warns that such interpretation of law would invalidate it, causing widespread chaos; urges courts to reject such obvious and flawed attempts to undermine law.
docs.snippet: The courts should reject a perverse new challenge to the law’s health insurance subsidies.

docs.lead_paragraph: A nuclear engineer who was first questioned two decades ago after the suspicious death of his new wife is on trial in Southern California on charges of murder and insurance fraud in what prosecutors say is a poisoning case.

headline.main: Man on Trial for Murder 20 Years After Wife Dies
headline.print_headline: Man on Trial for Murder 20 Years After Wife Dies

docs.snippet: A nuclear engineer who was first questioned two decades ago after the suspicious death of his new wife is on trial in Southern California on charges of murder and insurance fraud in what prosecutors say is a poisoning case.

docs.lead_paragraph: Administrators at 13 health centers run by the Department of Veterans Affairs misled investigators looking into the extent of waiting-list manipulation, an inspector general told the Senate.

headline.print_headline: Watchdog at V.A. Says Centers Lied

docs.abstract: Veterans Affairs Dept acting inspector general Richard J Griffin testifies at Senate hearing that administrators at 13 health care facilities run by the VA have lied to investigators looking into the extent of waiting-list manipulation and other improprieties; also says his office has found many instances of department administrators being involved in plots to hide delays in patient care.
docs.snippet: Administrators at 13 health centers run by the Department of Veterans Affairs misled investigators looking into the extent of waiting-list manipulation, an inspector general told the Senate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Trump Entertainment Resorts filed for bankruptcy Tuesday and threatened to shut down the Taj Mahal Casino Resort, which would make it the fifth Atlantic City casino to close this year.

headline.print_headline: Trump Casinos File Chapter 11; Seek Concessions
